column21: New residential developments of any kind are not permitted within the floodway. ADUs equal or less than 500 square feet may be conditionally permitted within the floodway (public hearing), and ADUs are permitted outside the floodway. Outside the floodway residential development is permitted conditionally (with public hearing).

column21: "For proposed development that is of an integrated, unified design, the DRB may approve lots as small as one-fourth acre, provided that doing so furthers the purpose of this section and Article II, Section 6.10 (B)."

column20:
"All residences in Duxbury are served by individual subsurface wastewater disposal Facilities, which must conform to the health regulations established in the Zoning Ordinance." (Town Plan: https://www.duxburyvermont.org/town-government/zoning)

"A maximum density of one unit per acre will be permitted for residential development; however, all multi-home developments should include provisions for open space, and PUDs are especially encouraged and may be conditionally permitted." (Town Plan: https://www.duxburyvermont.org/town-government/zoning)

column21:
New residential developments are only permitted within the Crossett Hill and Cemetery sub-areas. In both, single-family dwellings are permitted but only as part of a PUD.
Frontage: Crossett Hill: 100ft; Cemetery50ft
